Reviews.Title: “Excellent self catering accommodation in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Sandie66
Reviews.Content: Clean apartment in central Madrid. All main sights can be reached on foot with apartment located very close to Gran Via. Notwithstanding central location the apartment is located on a very quite street. The environment appeared safe both during the day and at night. Juan was very welcoming and despite language barrier managed to see to all our requests. The kitchen is well equipped and included a washing machine which we did not use. The sofa bed is somewhat small but was adequate for our teenage boys. Apartment is fully air-conditioned. A grocery shop is located up the road which was very convenient. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading description on Booking.com website”
Reviews.Author: Finntraveller215
Reviews.Content: The other reviews touch on the facts that the Caballero de Gracia apartments are very central, the beginning of the street is street walkers’ prowling area and that the apartments are pretty OK – that is if you are getting what you thought you had booked. We booked through Booking.com and being Finnish we get their website texts in Finnish. Thus I have no idea whether the descriptions are similar or different in other languages. Anyway we booked their 80 sq.m penthouse apartment for 8 days in June. According to the Booking.com description in Finnish this penthouse apartment has a balcony, large windows and plenty of natural light and free toiletries. At the time of our booking in May it also stated that there was a patio. Well, there is no balcony in the penthouse apartment. The windows are small and on the sloping roof section of the rooms, which means that there is not much natural light (and the view you get form the windows is of the sky). Free toiletries means hand wash soap in a bottle. (And there is no patio.) So, no surprise, when we got there and observed this discrepancy between what we were – based on the Booking.com website description – supposed to be getting and what the reality was we were dismayed. After a prolonged conference with Juan and Ana – and a local Booking.com rep on the phone – we accepted another apartment one floor down. This reasonably fitted the description that we had based our booking on, but at 70 sq.m was smaller. We suggested that the difference in acreage should be compensated; Juan and Ana would have none of it. This smaller apartment was nice enough. The washing machine door however was broken from the beginning. We only noticed it when we tried to open the door with our laundry in the machine. I called Juan and he said they’d come and open the door within an hour. After a day or two the fridge door too broke. During the 8 days of our visit there was no effort to fix either of these. And to go on with the theme of doors; we were three persons and we only got one key. To enter the building you first enter a gate and then a door into the staircase. There is a speaker/buzzer for both, but the staircase electric lock didn’t work at least from our apartment, which meant that if one of us came back earlier, he/she would then need to go down the stairs to admit the others. After the trip we complained to Booking.com that the apartment we had booked didn’t correspond with its (Finnish language) description on their website and that we should be compensated for this. After a prolonged correspondence Booking.com admitted that the website was wrong in claiming a patio; they didn’t acknowledge that it was wrong in claiming a balcony, large windows and plenty of natural light for the penthouse apartment – and indeed those claims are still there (the mention of the patio has been removed). Booking.com eventually agreed to compensate 10 % of the cost and pointed out that as soon as you make a reservation through Booking.com you enter into a relationship with the accommodation provider. Juan and Ana have been highly complimented in several reviews. When everything is fine, no doubt they give a pleasant impression of themselves. We found the uncompromising and arrogant when dealing with our problem and the fact that they only speak Spanish didn’t help either.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartments at red lights area”
Reviews.Author: Sergey I
Reviews.Content: The appartment's building is located near the city center, about two minutes walk to the nearest metro station. I want to note very friendly apartment's owner Juan, and although he spoke English very little, he left a very good impression. The apartments do not have the reception desk, you have the room and external doors keys.On the ground floor there is a computer, where you can go online and print the necessary documents (on your own paper). Room is equipped with modern kitchen appliances and have a separate little room for storage, clothing and luggage. Large windows overlook the tiny balcony and narrow street.The bed is big enough for a tall person. But there were also negative aspects. At the next major street Calle de la Montenera prostitutes are round the clock having their business. At night, it gives a special concern because they and their clients walking under the windows, laughing and talking loudly. If you do not open the windows it's almost unheard, but if you have a light sleep it might be a problem. The room has a faulty microwave oven (constant overheated and turned off). It was also not very convenient to the lack of small cooking cookware - were only huge pots and pans. Also, we were not able to adjust the air conditioner until the end - it is either cooled too much and roaring, or almost never worked and it was hot. A small inconvenience was that for 10 days was issued just two garbage bags.

Reviews.Title: “Juan is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Beverley S
Reviews.Content: Very nice, centrally located, well-equipped apartment. But the very best thing is the wonderful Juan who met us with the keys at the beginning of our stay and who was incredibly helpful, above and beyond what could be expected of him, when our hire car was towed away at the end of our stay. A really nice man.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 4 days and loved it. Fantastic location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: DGunz1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife at the start of a trip around Spain. The location is very close to the centre of nightlife in Madrid but in a very quiet street, no problem with noise at all. Prostitutes are certainly in evidence in the street that it joins on to but they were no problem - and this is the middle of a big city after all. Rooms were 3-4 star but really very comfortable and everything worked fine. Juan speaks little or no English but is really helpful despite this. Would certainly stay here again if I was back in Madrid. So much better than a cramped hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: livetotravelcdn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of a long vacation in Spain and Portugal. We were looking for a location that would be central, and easy to reach after dropping off our rental car at the airport. We weren't looking for much, since by the end of a vacation you are often just thinking about getting home, and hoping that the house is still standing when you return. This hotel turned out to be a very pleasant surprise. We were met by the owner, who gave us an exuberant greeting. He spoke a little English, and my wife speaks a little Spanish, so between the two they managed to communicate that the room wasn't quite ready when we arrived. No problem, we left our bags and found a patio around the corner to have some Sangria. When we returned, our bags had been moved to the 3rd floor room, and the owner showed us around. It was a large apartment, with a bedroom, bathroom, kitchenette (fridge, stove, oven, dishwasher, clothes washer), sitting area, and a small balcony overlooking the street. Utensils and towels were also included. We had been talking about wine we first arrived, and when we returned the owner presented us with a nice bottle of wine from a vineyard near Cuenca. We explained that we had to leave early on our departure day to catch our flight, so the owner phoned and booked a taxi for us. Overall, the apartment was very convenient, far enough from Gran Via to be quiet, but close enough to the main streets to make it easy to find, and to find the main attractions. We ran into the owner several times during our stay, and he was always very friendly, asking how things were going, and offering assistance. He also provided a great restaurant recommendation; La Gloria De Montera, located just down the street from the apartment, which had very good food and even better prices.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place, great apartment!”
Reviews.Author: ulatarantula
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in this apartment for 5 nights. Perfect location in the heart of Madrid, It was very clean, comfortable, and well equipped. Juan was very helpfull. He gave us a bottle of wine and a large map.

Reviews.Title: “This is a rare find. Thank you to Juan and the team. Superb service.”
Reviews.Author: scrank
Reviews.Content: Juan is a true gentleman and his Hotel is a wonderful value for money find. Great location, very clean and apart from not having wi-fi in the room (although free internet available) is perfect. Juan (Manager) did me a great service when I left my iPad behind. He arranged for it be shipped to my requested location and inisted I pay nothing extra than the DHL delivery costs. That is a rare and greatly appreciated gesture and a reflection of this establishment. If Madrid is your town for a stay, this place is a real winner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for seeing all the sights”
Reviews.Author: coupleCarlow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in September and really enjoyed this place. It is so central, you do not need a taxi or metro at all. The apartment was clean, modern and had everything you need for a short city trip. Air-conditioned as well. It would not be suitable for small children though and it can get noisy, especially at weekends. But would recommend it to couples who want to enjoy the museums and other sights. Prado just 10 min. walk away! And do go for a meal in La Gracia de la Montera, just a few doors away, amazing value, but does not open until 8.30pm for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS APARTMENT”
Reviews.Author: LondonLje
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this apartment for 4 nights and would not recommend it at all especially for anyone stayin with children. The area around the apartment is full of prostitutes, the apartment above is let out to the prostitutes for them to bring clients back to. This results in people walking/down the stair/lifts. This takes place all day/night. During the night you have men ringing on the intercom of your apartment. A key is left in the front door, all night to enable the prostitutes/clients to enter the building. Some of the clients force and bang on the door of your apartment, unaware of what apartment they should be going to. I have been to South Africa, and felt safer there then I did staying at this aparment. The actual apartment was not too bad, clean tidy and comfortable. But even if you have paid your deposit to this place, PLEASE THINK TWICE BEFORE STAYING!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment in central location”
Reviews.Author: chylle
Reviews.Content: We love this apartment. Its in a very central location, close to Sol and Gran Via. There are many food and shopping choices available, and several convenience store nearby. Its about 2 minutes to metro station. The owner was very friendly and even gave us a free bottle of wine on our first night. The room itself was spacious and complete with amenities (Free internet, TV with English shows too) and we couldn't have asked for more. Would definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, good value, extremely central apartments”
Reviews.Author: JK44
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Madrid staying in the apartments at Caballero de Gracias. You can walk to almost anywhere from the apartments - they are 2 minutes from a main shopping area, 2 minutes from a Madrid Vision tour bus stop, 5 mins from Puerto del Sol & Plaza Mayor - 10 mins to the Prado. Or if you prefer you have the metro at Grand Via - or slightly further Sol or Sevilla - a really perfect position. In the same street are a number of restaurants & cafes of varying prices & sophistication & a small local basic grocery shop. The apartments are well equipped, clean, smart & comfortable. Juan speaks limited English, and our Spanish is non existent, but he is charming and helpful. And if shoes/boots are on your list of "to do's" the shoe shops of Calle de Augusto Figueroa in Chueca are approx 6 minutes walk away - what more do you need?
